column1: What should you expect when applying for a job at North Star Marketing?
The first step is to make sure that you have completely filled out the form on our website at https://www.northstarmarketing.com/jobs. That will get the process started.

We start off with a quick (15 to 20 minute) phone interview. This is mainly to get to know each other and make sure that we are on the same page for what the job entails and that you are willing and capable of doing the work. There are a few very high-level development questions that will be asked but that is just to give us an idea of your current development knowledge.

The second step is for us to give you a small (shouldn't take more than 5 hours to complete) project in order for us to see your code and how you work. This may be an optional step depending on the availability of coding samples. We normally allow two weeks for this to be completed but if you need more time
column2: just ask. Communication is a big deal. There is the possibility that there will be another project depending on the number of applications and if there is something
column4: we are looking for that might not have been communicated well. This will be on an as-needed basis and also should not take any longer than 5 hours to complete.

column1: The third phase of the interview process is a Dev Team interview. This is where you get to meet the team you would be working with and we can talk about your project as well as any other questions you might have or our team might have for you.
The fourth part of our hiring process is a North Star Team interview. For this
column2: we will bring you into the office to meet face-to-face with the leadership team and a good portion of the North Star team.

column1: The entire process normally takes about 4-weeks but it depends on the total number of applicants and scheduling. Our goal is to clearly communicate with you during this process. If you have any questions you can always shoot us an email and we will be happy to answer.
Pay may depend on skills and/or qualifications
A job for which all ages
Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma"
